WorkItem.ClosedComment: This has been released in 2.3.1.  Use the AcknowledgeX12 as an example of how to use the OopFactory.X12.Validation assembly to create 999 acknowledgement files from any X12 file.
WorkItem.Description:
First I have to say thanks.  I was about start writing my own parser and you and the dev team have just saved me weeks of work.  Second your design is great. I consider myself a decent programmer but you guys have awesome skills.
Along those same lines I spent a few hours trying to find where to start.  I think I have the hang of the parser and now need to make an acknowledgement 997 file for a 5010.  Does the capability exist to make one or can you point me in the right direction if you have already made that module. Thanks, Doug.

Comments.Message:
I need to work on that part of the documentation, but for now you can look at this discussion http://x12parser.codeplex.com/discussions/265463 to see some code samples for creating a message.  The example uses an 837, but you can specify a 997 and it should pick up the specification for the 997.
I will keep this issue open until I provide that documentation as it's own wiki page.
Thanks for the update and information.

Hi dstrubhar, I looked through the info you gave me and I think I asked the wrong question.  After reading more on the x12 formats and the 5010 i think i need to creat a 999 acknowledgement file.  I need to read in an 837 in the new 5010 format and produce a 999(?) and not a 997.  Would I use a transformation object to do that?  Ca you show me a small code sample that might do that?  Thanks again.
